page.title: 01King's Sutton
page.content: The beautiful church spire of KING'S SUTTON can be seen for miles as this large village stands on rising ground surrounded by good agricultural land. This prosperous farming area has both arable and grass fields. The village is in Northamptonshire, just over the border from Oxfordshire. The River Cherwell, the Oxford Canal and the railway all pass close by the west of the village as they run south from Banbury to Oxford. There is a small station at King's Sutton. The new motorway should soon be built along this valley too. The manor house and the old part of the village are near the church. Now there is Council housing and plenty of new private housing too.
